title: Maternal veil (Pido)
text: In Rajasthan, the mother of a newborn son traditionally wore a yellow veil known as a <I>pido<I>.  Ten small lotus medallions symbolized the months of pregnancy and birth, while a large central lotus signaled the creation of a new life.  Asking for a <I>pido<I> was a time-honored way for a wife to tell her husband she was expecting.
description: yellow central rectangle bordered with red containing black central medallion with orange and red floral design; ten small circles on either side of medallion; wide black borders with orange and red organic design bands
creditline: Gift of Richard L. Simmons in memory of Roberta Grodberg Simmons
